etymologies: late 17th century. From classical Latin rāmulus little branch, twig from rāmus branch + -ulus

definitions: A small branch; specifically a branch belonging to a second (or higher) order of branching.

In certain plants belonging to the subfamily Tristichoideae of the family Podostemaceae: a photosynthetic organ with scaly leaves, variously considered to be homologous to a shoot or a compound leaf, or intermediate between these.
